column5: have not had any fishing to report lately. Been too busy with the joys of the harvest. Time to can some of that summer warmth    I'm still picking a bushel a week of the jalapenos. Nother few weeks and they'l pull all the tomatoes in the hoop houses. Can you say pickled green tomatoes?
DAMN! Those jalapenos look divine. Jalapenos are way better than the orange/yellow hot peppers. Do you grow then outdoors? Do they need a specific climate?
mmmm...gotta like a good bout if indigestion!  Looks good!
~~~~Oh Yeah a few of those and stay away up wind of me, I'll take 2 jars please, trying to cut back
some a those in scrambled eggs with toast and sausages for breakfast.....im drippin all over the please here....
Great stuff Bruce Sounds like the harvest is keeping you off the shoreline these days Love the label on the salsa jars Thanks for sharing!!! Jacques

Bruce is this year batch of salsa as good as last years.  The jars you shared with me last fall where as good as any salsa I have had anywhere  Anybody who has not tried it is missing out.  I got the empty jars all ready to return to you on Sunday.
I'm certain I will not disappoint you. Was that medium, hot, or ?????
I think it was medium...had just a little bit of bite to it. I can't tolerate a lot of heat so whatever it was...it was perfect.
do you sell the salsa at a farmers market or something?
I'm up at St Jakobs most Saturdays til the snow flies. A good friend has run a farm stall there for the past 20 years. We have a hoot.
excellent, we'll definitely try to get up there.  working every other saturday makes it difficult sometimes, but we'll do our best.
